Articles.Content:
> 
> After updating to 1.6.6 the game will no longer load. After the loading sequence I just end up at a black screen with the words "Kerbal Space Program" in a small grey box in the upper left hand corner. Anyone else run into this?

hmmmm, most likely it could be a simple install error. Do you have the latest kopernicus? also if you could give me a screenshot of your gamedata folder so i can check all's good. Cheers dude!

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/XXXTp)

I am playing around with NH 64k right now, here you have some screens of my station's first module launch.

I hope you enjoy ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

When I try using EVE and a cloud pack from Avera9eJoe ([http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/126611-1-0-4-Avg-s-Cloud-Pack-v6-tinted-auroras-Stratus-Cirrus-level-clouds-Lightning-Dust-storms](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/126611-1-0-4-Avg-s-Cloud-Pack-v6-tinted-auroras-Stratus-Cirrus-level-clouds-Lightning-Dust-storms))

My game crashes when running it with New Horizons.

Anyway to fix possibly ?

> 
> When I try using EVE and a cloud pack from Avera9eJoe ([http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/126611-1-0-4-Avg-s-Cloud-Pack-v6-tinted-auroras-Stratus-Cirrus-level-clouds-Lightning-Dust-storms](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/126611-1-0-4-Avg-s-Cloud-Pack-v6-tinted-auroras-Stratus-Cirrus-level-clouds-Lightning-Dust-storms))
> My game crashes when running it with New Horizons.
> 
> Anyway to fix possibly ?

New Horizons isn't designed to run with cloud packs like AVG's. It shouldn't crash, though, unless you also tried to install NH's custom cloud pack and there's a weird conflict.
KillAshley, will you add moar planets or moons? we need MOAR!!!![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> I am playing around with NH 64k right now, here you have some screens of my station's first module launch.
> 
> I hope you enjoy ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

very cool dude, cheers!

> 
> When I try using EVE and a cloud pack from Avera9eJoe ([http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/126611-1-0-4-Avg-s-Cloud-Pack-v6-tinted-auroras-Stratus-Cirrus-level-clouds-Lightning-Dust-storms](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/126611-1-0-4-Avg-s-Cloud-Pack-v6-tinted-auroras-Stratus-Cirrus-level-clouds-Lightning-Dust-storms))
> My game crashes when running it with New Horizons.
> 
> Anyway to fix possibly ?

I have no idea tbh. Is it a RAM crash? unfortunately only EVE support i have available atm is for my own custom setup. Try it from the OP and see if you still get the crashes.

> 
> KillAshley, will you add moar planets or moons? we need MOAR!!!![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

nope, 100% nope. NH is at roughly at "scope-complete" and already has a HUGE selection of moons available. Any new worlds can easily be added through other planet packs, but this one won't be adding any more ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)

Spaceplane to Serran, at last ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)[https://flic.kr/p/Aezdvp](https://flic.kr/p/Aezdvp)

Took a bit of work, but in the end I stuck the landing first time, at a nice slow 55 m/s or so. Having done most of my landing practice full of fuel on Kerbin at much higher speeds, Serran was easy in comparison.

Subject to ore concentration, I like the area - the crater at the east of the redlands - as a base location, it's nice and flat and low.

> 
> Spaceplane to Serran, at last ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

very cool \o/

Got a new problem ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Apparently the bug concerning the disappearing ships went from Mun to Aptur, lost my first orbiting satellite as well as a Kerbal awaiting rescue.

Version should be 1.6.6, notable mod would be 64K
Now with 1.0.5 and it's temperature limits Ernus became extremely hard...

> 
> Now with 1.0.5 and it's temperature limits Ernus became extremely hard...

Completely incidentally, this was the post that alerted me to 1.0.5 being out ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I've seen an odd problem with 1.0.5: Ships sink like a stone in water!

It's a Kopernicus issue, and not a problem with NH itself. Just wanted to mention it here, as I expect folks will be running into it. The Kopernicus team has [posted](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114649-1-0-4-Kopernicus-Beta-%280-4%29-September-14?p=2286356#post2286356) that they know about the issue and are working on a 1.0.5-compatible update, but it may be a while.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Now with 1.0.5 and it's temperature limits Ernus became extremely hard...

On the other hand, I hear that they've fixed the bug in the active radiators so that when they track the sun to go edge-on to radiate efficiently, it *actually works*. Was looking forward to giving Ernus a try now that we have functioning radiators.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-11-10T16:58:46Z" title="11/10/2015 04:58  PM" data-short="8 yr">November 10, 2015</time> by Snark**

> 
> Completely incidentally, this was the post that alerted me to 1.0.5 being out ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Same... I was waiting for tonight's dev notes to announce it ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Well, this mod looks like work properly on 1.0.5, but I has fps=6 when using craft with 90 details, so looks like Ernus will wait until 1.1. ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)
how heavy this mod on the fps? -30 -20 fps?and for the ram usage as well?

RAM use is middling - probably about the same as EVE. Picking one or the other is advised.

There's no reason a planet pack would impact your FPS, outside of being in the locality of the planets it contains... I would suspect no impact at all.

Remember New Horizons, like all planet packs, depends on Kopernicus. I don't think Kopernicus has been updated yet and IIRC the current version has some issues with 1.0.5.x

Back in 1.0.4 I'd say it had less than a 10% fps drop.

Ah, maybe there is then. I'm resisting the urge to kerbal until 1.1 and 64 bit, so I'm interested yet out of the loop atm ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Saw [a post in the Kopernicus thread](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114649-1-0-4-Kopernicus-Beta-%280-4%29-September-14?p=2292420&viewfull=1#post2292420) that it looks like a development (non-release) version of Kopernicus.dll is available on github that avoids the water-buoyancy problem.

Haven't tested it myself yet, just tossing it out there in case folks are interested.
Nolas looks like something out of a really cool sci-fi movie, I like it, I like it a lot.

Hi there,

I am building some kind of map, showing the needed DV to travel into the system.

First 2 pictures, then 2 questions.

OVERVIEW

![newhorizons%27map.jpg](http://www.cubx.net/pub/newhorizons%27map.jpg)

ZOOM

![newhorizons%27map2.jpg](http://www.cubx.net/pub/newhorizons%27map2.jpg)

Two questions :

2 /

It is unders construction (sonnah, ground Ã‚Â¿), and I plan to share that map when finished (at least an emtpy one).

So **any remark will be welcome**. Notably : in which format would you like it ? 

1 /

I drawn the paths TO Sonnah and it's moon's, as destination from SOL edge.

Does someone have an idea on how to draw it **FROM** **sonnah** (Kerbin to be precise), taking in consideration we start from there ?

I feel the "destinatin TO Sonnah" branch is ok (pertinent, necessary), but there are some bridges missing at leat, or what ?

You could have lines from low kerbin orbit to the intercept of each of the other moons ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif). Gets messy when you include their orbits to kerbin intercept though...

Also, Astid, Tidus and Dres seem to be missing. I like the idea, but starting from Kerbin would be more intuitive for most people, or starting from Sol.

This map is a little easier to make sense of.

[![UUU8yCk.png](http://i.imgur.com/UUU8yCk.png)](http://r.search.yahoo.com/_ylt=A2KLj.oG8EhWlW0AEo7.3olQ;_ylu=X3oDMTBxNG1oMmE2BHNlYwNmcC1hdHRyaWIEc2xrA3J1cmwEaXQD/RV=2/RE=1447649414/RO=11/RU=http%3A%2F%2Fkerbalproof.com%2F/RK=0/RS=czEC3PTBhVnb.LiH2WyM6MBwccI-)
KillAshley, will you add some easter eggs to this mod?

Hi,  

Thanks for the comments.
